title: (x) Campbell's Soup - hand lettering {Eduardo, Daniel Weaver}
author: clearbolt

comments.content:
After looking at some [real pictures](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108185033/http:/images.google.com.br/images?hl=pt-BR&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8&q=campbells&sa=N&tab=wi&meta=) (it's hard to ID from Warhol's   
painting) of a Campbell's soup can, I'm sure it's not a typeface.   
It's a lettering job.   
   
 [Emigre Fairplex](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108185033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/fairplex/narrow-black/testdrive.html?s=SOUP&p=96) has similar serifs, FWIW.
Cambells Soup is one of the oldest public brands out there, it had to be hand lettered. There is a russian site that has logos it.
